service.name: Assistance for Isolated Children Scheme Additional Boarding Allowance
service.description: AIC Scheme Additional Boarding Allowance (ABA) is a means-tested supplementary payment to provide additional support for lower-income families whose geographically isolated student boards away from their principal family home. ABA is payable only if the actual boarding charges are greater than the minimum threshold of the rate of Basic Boarding Allowance less $250 for incidentals.

Dimension.name: Assistance for Isolated Children Scheme
Dimension.desc: Help for students who cannot go to an appropriate state school because of geographical isolation, disability or special health needs.

Dimension.name: Rural and remote Australians
Dimension.desc: A range of payments and services is available to support people living in rural and remote areas.

Dimension.name: Centrelink
Dimension.desc: Delivering a range of payments and services for people at times of major change.
